definitions: business of producing and distributing books, magazines, and other written materials
act of making information or creative work available to the public
examples: She worked in publishing for twenty years before starting her agency
The publishing industry has adapted quickly to digital formats
Academic publishing requires rigorous peer review before acceptance
Self-publishing has become increasingly popular among independent authors

definitions: hard rubber disk used in ice hockey and related games
playful or mischievous fairy or demon in folklore and literature
examples: The player slapped the puck into the upper corner of the net
They practiced passing the puck across the ice for hours
Shakespeare's Puck creates chaos in A Midsummer Night's Dream
The puck in folklore often played tricks on unsuspecting travelers

definitions: soft, sweet dessert typically made with milk, eggs, and flavoring
savory dish made from meat, suet, or vegetables traditionally steamed or boiled
examples: The chocolate pudding was topped with fresh whipped cream
She made bread pudding from yesterday's leftover baguette
Black pudding is a traditional breakfast item in Scotland
The steak and kidney pudding steamed for three hours

definitions: small shallow pool of water, especially from rain
small amount of any liquid that has collected in one place
examples: Children love jumping in puddles after the rain stops
The dog walked straight through the muddy puddle
There was a puddle of oil under the car engine
She noticed a puddle of melted ice cream on the table

definitions: traditional multi-story dwelling structure built by Native American peoples of the Southwest
small town or village in Spanish-speaking regions, especially in the American Southwest
examples: The ancient pueblo at Mesa Verde showcases remarkable architectural skills
Taos Pueblo has been continuously inhabited for over 1000 years
The pueblo celebrated its annual feast day with traditional dances
Many pueblos in New Mexico maintain their historic character

definitions: short blast of breath or wind expelled forcefully
small cloud of smoke, vapor, or dust
light pastry made with layers of dough that expand when baked
soft pad or cushion used for applying powder
examples: She blew a puff of air to cool the hot soup
A puff of wind scattered the dandelion seeds everywhere
The dragon released a puff of smoke from its nostrils
Puffs of steam rose from the locomotive's chimney
The cream puffs were filled with vanilla custard
She made cheese puffs for the party appetizers
She used a powder puff to apply makeup evenly
The velvet puff felt soft against her skin

definitions: fish that can inflate its body with water or air as defense
thick padded jacket filled with down or synthetic material for warmth
device used to deliver medication through inhalation
examples: The puffer inflated instantly when the predator approached
Puffers contain tetrodotoxin, making them deadly if improperly prepared
She wore a bright red puffer to stay warm in winter
The puffer jacket compressed easily into the backpack
He always carries his asthma puffer in his pocket
The child learned how to use the puffer correctly

definitions: marine fish that inflates its body with water or air when threatened and contains deadly toxins
examples: The pufferfish is considered a delicacy in Japan despite its danger
Marine biologists study pufferfish toxins for potential medical applications
The aquarium's pufferfish puffed up when visitors tapped the glass
Pufferfish require specialized care due to their unique dietary needs

definitions: small Arctic seabird with colorful beak, black and white plumage, known for cliff nesting
examples: Puffins return to the same nesting sites every breeding season
The puffin's colorful beak becomes brighter during mating season
Iceland hosts the largest puffin colonies in the world
Tourists flock to see puffins during summer months

definitions: act of breathing hard and fast, especially from exertion
action of swelling or inflating something with air or gas
examples: The puffing from climbing stairs revealed his poor fitness
Her puffing and wheezing concerned the other hikers
The puffing of the dough in the oven created perfect croissants
The puffing of his chest showed his pride

definitions: small dog breed with wrinkled face, curled tail, and short muzzle
examples: Their pug snores loudly due to its flat face structure
The pug's playful personality makes it a popular family pet
Pugs require regular cleaning of their facial wrinkles
The ancient Chinese bred pugs as companion dogs for royalty

definitions: informal term for vomit or the expelled contents of the stomach
examples: The janitor had to clean puke from the school hallway
There was puke on his shirt after the roller coaster
The smell of puke made everyone feel nauseated
Dog puke on the carpet required immediate cleaning

definitions: act or force of drawing something toward oneself or in a direction
ability to influence or attract people or resources
attractive quality or appeal that draws interest
examples: The pull of the current was too strong to swim against
He felt a sharp pull in his shoulder muscle
Her political pull helped secure funding for the project
The senator has considerable pull with the committee
The pull of the big city attracted young professionals
The gravitational pull affects ocean tides

definitions: withdrawal of military forces from an advanced position to a previous one
temporary decline in stock prices or market values after a period of gains
examples: The general ordered a strategic pullback to defensive positions
The pullback allowed troops to regroup and resupply
Investors saw the pullback as a buying opportunity
A 10% pullback in tech stocks worried some traders

definitions: person who pulls something as their job or activity
tool or device designed to extract or pull objects
examples: The rickshaw puller navigated through the crowded streets
Cart pullers worked long hours at the warehouse
Use a nail puller to remove the old boards safely
The bearing puller made the repair job much easier

definitions: wheel with grooved rim around which rope or chain passes, used to lift heavy objects
examples: The pulley system made lifting the piano to the third floor possible
Engineers designed a complex pulley arrangement for the construction crane
She demonstrated how pulleys reduce the force needed to lift weights
The old well used a simple pulley to raise water buckets

definitions: continuous action of drawing or dragging something in a particular direction
examples: The pulling of the heavy sled exhausted the dogs
Constant pulling on the rope caused blisters on his hands
The pulling sensation in her leg indicated a muscle strain
The child's pulling at her sleeve demanded attention

definitions: soft, wet, shapeless mass of material, especially from plants
fibrous material prepared from wood for making paper
soft fleshy part of fruit
sensational or lurid fiction originally printed on cheap paper
examples: The machine crushed the sugar cane into pulp
Wood pulp forms the basis of most paper products
The paper mill processes thousands of tons of pulp daily
Recycled pulp reduces the need for cutting trees
Orange pulp contains beneficial fiber and vitamins
She strained the pulp from the freshly squeezed juice
He collected vintage pulp fiction magazines from the 1950s
Pulp novels featured dramatic covers and sensational stories

definitions: raised platform or stand in a church from which the preacher delivers sermons
examples: The minister ascended the carved wooden pulpit to begin the sermon
The historic pulpit dates back to the 18th century
From the pulpit, she delivered a powerful message about compassion
The church's marble pulpit features intricate religious carvings

definitions: regular rhythmic beating, throbbing, or vibrating movement, especially of the heart or arteries
examples: The doctor monitored the pulsation of the patient's carotid artery
She felt the pulsation in her temples during the migraine
The pulsation of the bass speakers shook the entire building
Astronomers detected regular pulsations from the distant star

definitions: regular beating of arteries as blood is pumped through them by the heart
edible seeds of leguminous plants such as lentils, beans, and peas
brief burst of energy, light, sound, or electric current
examples: The nurse checked his pulse at his wrist
Her pulse quickened when she heard the news
Pulses are an excellent source of plant-based protein
The recipe calls for mixed pulses soaked overnight
The laser emits pulses of light every millisecond
An electromagnetic pulse disabled all electronic devices

definitions: producing a regular throbbing or beating sensation or movement
examples: The pulsing of the music vibrated through the dance floor
She noticed the pulsing vein in his forehead when angry
The pulsing lights created a hypnotic effect at the concert
A pulsing pain in his tooth kept him awake

definitions: large American wild cat with tawny coat, also known as cougar or mountain lion
examples: The puma stalked its prey silently through the forest
Pumas can leap up to 40 feet horizontally
Wildlife cameras captured a puma crossing the mountain trail
The puma's territory can span over 300 square miles

definitions: mechanical device that moves fluids or gases by pressure or suction
woman's shoe with low-cut front and no fastening, typically with a heel
examples: The water pump failed, causing the engine to overheat
They installed a new pump to drain the flooded basement
She wore black pumps to the business meeting
The bride chose white satin pumps for the wedding

definitions: large round orange squash with thick shell, commonly used for food and decoration
examples: They carved a pumpkin for Halloween decoration
The pumpkin pie was the highlight of Thanksgiving dinner
The farmer grew giant pumpkins for the county fair
Pumpkin seeds make a nutritious roasted snack

definitions: humorous play on words exploiting different meanings or similar sounds for comic effect
examples: His constant puns made everyone groan at the dinner table
The headline contained a clever pun about the bakery theft
Shakespeare filled his plays with puns and wordplay
The pun on 'thyme' and 'time' amused the cooking class

definitions: forceful strike with the fist
drink typically made from fruit juice mixed with spices or alcohol
tool for making holes in materials or for stamping designs
examples: The boxer delivered a powerful punch to his opponent's jaw
She threw a punch in self-defense
The party punch contained a secret blend of tropical juices
They served rum punch at the Caribbean restaurant
Use a hole punch to prepare the documents for binding
The leather punch created perfect holes for the belt

definitions: final phrase or sentence of a joke that provides the humor or twist
examples: The comedian delivered the punchline with perfect timing
Everyone laughed when they finally got the punchline
She forgot the punchline and ruined the entire joke
The punchline subverted everyone's expectations brilliantly

definitions: quality of being on time or doing things at the agreed or proper time
examples: His punctuality impressed the interview panel
The train service prides itself on punctuality
Punctuality is highly valued in Japanese business culture
Her lack of punctuality caused problems at work

definitions: system of marks such as periods, commas, and question marks used in writing to clarify meaning
examples: Proper punctuation helps readers understand the text clearly
The editor corrected numerous punctuation errors in the manuscript
English punctuation differs from other languages' systems
She taught punctuation rules to her writing students

definitions: small hole made by a sharp object, especially in something inflated
act of making a hole with something pointed
examples: The puncture in the tire caused a slow leak
A nail caused the puncture in the bicycle tube
The doctor performed a lumbar puncture to collect spinal fluid
The puncture wound required immediate medical attention

definitions: expert who frequently gives opinions about a subject in public, especially on television or radio
examples: Political pundits analyzed the election results on cable news
The sports pundit predicted an upset in the championship
Financial pundits offered conflicting advice about the market
She became a respected pundit on environmental issues

definitions: penalty inflicted on someone as retribution for wrong or crime, or as discipline
examples: The punishment for theft was three years in prison
Parents debated whether punishment or reward worked better
The harsh punishment didn't fit the minor crime
Capital punishment remains controversial in many countries

definitions: loud, fast-moving rock music and associated rebellious youth subculture from the 1970s
worthless or contemptible person (informal, often offensive)
soft, decayed wood used as tinder
examples: Punk rock emerged in London and New York in the mid-1970s
She dressed in punk fashion with ripped jeans and safety pins
The old man called the vandals punks and troublemakers
Don't be such a punk; stand up for yourself
The campers used dry punk to start their fire
Punk wood crumbles easily when touched

definitions: long flat-bottomed boat propelled with a pole, used on rivers
kick in football where the ball is dropped and kicked before hitting ground
bet or wager, especially in British informal usage
examples: They hired a punt to explore the Cambridge river
The punt glided silently through the shallow water
The team decided to punt on fourth down
His punt traveled fifty yards down the field
He took a punt on the startup company
It's worth a punt at those odds

definitions: customer or client, especially of a shop or business (British informal)
player who punts the ball in American football
person who bets or gambles, especially on horses
person who propels a punt boat with a pole
examples: The shop relies on regular punters for most of its business
Punters lined up early for the store's sale
The team's punter averaged 45 yards per kick
The punter practiced his technique daily
Professional punters study form guides before placing bets
The punter lost heavily at the races
The experienced punter navigated the river expertly
Punters in Oxford offer tours to visitors

definitions: activity of propelling a punt boat along a river with a pole
act of kicking the football by dropping and kicking before it hits ground
examples: Punting on the River Cam is a popular tourist activity
They spent the afternoon punting and picnicking
His punting technique improved after coaching sessions
The team's punting game was their strongest asset

definitions: young dog, seal, or other carnivorous mammal before reaching adult size
examples: The seal pup stayed close to its mother on the beach
Wolf pups learn hunting skills through play
The golden retriever pup chewed everything in sight
They adopted a pup from the animal shelter

definitions: student in school or someone who is taught by another
dark circular opening in the center of the iris of the eye
examples: The teacher had thirty pupils in her classroom
The art master's star pupil won the competition
The doctor shined a light to check if pupils were dilated
Her pupils contracted in the bright sunlight

definitions: movable figure controlled by strings or hand for entertainment or theater
person or organization controlled by another and lacking independence
examples: The puppet show delighted children at the library
She manipulated the puppet's strings with expert skill
Critics called him a puppet of corporate interests
The puppet government had no real authority

definitions: person who manipulates puppets as entertainment or artistic performance
examples: The puppeteer brought the characters to life with skilled movements
Professional puppeteers train for years to master their craft
Jim Henson was a legendary puppeteer who created the Muppets
The puppeteer worked behind the screen during the show

definitions: art or practice of performing with puppets in entertainment or theater
examples: Indonesian shadow puppetry tells traditional epic stories
She studied puppetry at the performing arts school
Modern puppetry combines technology with traditional techniques
The festival showcased puppetry from around the world

definitions: young domestic dog, typically under one year of age
examples: The puppy wagged its tail excitedly when they arrived home
Training a puppy requires patience and consistency
They chose the smallest puppy from the litter
The puppy chewed through three pairs of shoes

definitions: item that has been bought or acquired through payment
act or process of buying something
firm grip or foothold enabling movement or leverage
examples: The purchase arrived within two days of ordering
She returned the purchase for a full refund
The purchase of the house took three months to complete
Online purchase has become increasingly popular
The climber couldn't find purchase on the smooth rock face
His boots provided good purchase on the icy ground

definitions: person who buys something, especially on behalf of an organization
examples: The purchaser requested a detailed invoice for tax purposes
First-time home purchasers may qualify for special programs
The company's chief purchaser negotiated better supplier contracts
Purchasers at the auction bid aggressively for rare items

definitions: action or process of buying goods or services
department in organization responsible for buying supplies and materials
examples: Online purchasing has transformed retail shopping habits
Bulk purchasing often results in significant discounts
She works in purchasing at the manufacturing company
The purchasing department approved the new vendor

definitions: animal, especially dog or horse, bred from parents of the same breed with documented ancestry
examples: The purebred German Shepherd came with registration papers
Purebred horses command higher prices at auction
They preferred adopting mixed breeds over expensive purebreds
The cat show only accepted purebred entries

definitions: in Catholic theology, intermediate state after death for purification before heaven
place or state of temporary suffering or misery
examples: Catholic doctrine teaches that souls undergo purification in purgatory
Medieval artists depicted purgatory in dramatic paintings
The long wait at the DMV felt like purgatory
His job had become a purgatory of endless meetings

definitions: act of removing unwanted elements or people from an organization or place
abrupt removal of people from positions of authority or influence, often political
examples: The annual purge of old files freed up storage space
The body uses fever to purge itself of infection
The political purge removed dozens of party officials
Stalin's purges eliminated millions of perceived enemies

definitions: continuous process of removing or eliminating unwanted elements or substances
examples: The purging of toxins from the body requires adequate hydration
Regular purging of outdated inventory reduces storage costs
The purging of corrupt officials restored public trust
Data purging helps maintain database efficiency
